By the definition nowadays, There are always someone getting NTRed, if you read a manga, and the main characters end up together, then there has to be some side character that is getting NTRed.

Hence according to me, it's all about the perspective, if the love interest of main character is taken away from him. It's NTR for me. Even if the main character and the love interest are in relationship or the love interest was already in a relationship.

Here, even though it's NTR, I won't go out of my way to hate it because the girl was looking for casual hookups, the MC never tried shit to begin with so the girl did not "betray" him. The little sister was already a sex addict degenerate, she doesn't likes the mc, just gets the sexual satisfaction out of tormenting him.
We've read other works where the FMC tries to cheer up the mc. She's just getting the kick out of it.

Hence this might now be as bad as a NTR, it's bad nonetheless.

@Thighslayer. No, it is NOT NTR. There's zero humiliation here. NTR involves taking, which is why it's in the title. BUT...She. Was. Never. His. Meaning the title is a lie designed to sucker in the NTR crowd. You can only have something taken from you if you had it in the first place. All it would've taken to make this semi-NTR, would be a couple of sentences" You know Souta liked you, right?""Sure, and liked him, too, but when I put that flag that I wanted to have raw sex with a boyfriend and he bailed, I'm just glad you were a real man, with your god-tier equipment, and didn't wimp out like he did!" If the girl is clueless that she's NTRing you, and has ZERO reason to believe she's NTRing you: You. Are. Not. Being. NTRed. Jealousy and self-loathing: They're not just for NTR stories.

Then Souta discovered himself a sadist fetish and continued this relationship without thinking. One day, Akiho declared that she's deeply in love with him and that she wants to go out with him, but the trauma of his first love isn't away yet but she tells him that it's was her fault so he can take time to heal, and that she will help hip to heal. They proceed to go out and with time they get a sane relationship. But the specter of treason is never completely faded, and it turns out Souta tried to hit Masahito but got beaten by him, and Akiho (who is clearly yandere) got Masahito beaten up himself by others. But Haruka discovered that and the relation between the sisters got really hard. Here we could see different potentiel endings, but no happy ones. body: Here, illiterates: "Netorare is more than a simple act of infidelity, but the fetishization of jealousy and other negative feelings commonly associated with it. [...] The protagonist's significant other, a very close friend, or in some cases, a close relative is stolen [...] It doesn't necessarily mean that they are literally stolen, but the negative feelings experienced by their significant other might make it seem so [...] The one who loses their loved one almost always finds out about the situation and suffers from jealousy and the feeling of helplessness arisen from an inability to change anything."
